review_title: Wanna waste your time? Play this!
one_reviews_text: Complete waste of time. Not even a demo. When you think the fun is about to start, it ends. Graphics are extremely poor, you shoot a bunch of bottles and that's the most "fun" you will have with this. You swing ONCE like spiderman, see a monster, shoot a few spider webs to "catch a falling crane"... no comments... and thne it ends. Too short, poorly developed ( I say this as a game developer myself ) and a complete waste of your time. Not even Spiderman fan kids would like this. If I were a little kid that likes Spiderman I would literally cry after this "experience". BOOOO!
dont waste ur time. the second you load in you get disconnected from the game

the "experience" is just a short shooting gallery, nothing more than that
the tutorial is the whole game

review_title: Ad, for a non vr game?
one_reviews_text: I have to compliment on the graphics of this game, spiderman is REALLY detailed, and the view, i gasped because of how pretty it is. But now, let's talk about the gameplay. This "experience" is just a tutorial IN VR for a NON VR ps4 game, and not even a good one at that, the swinging is semi-good but its all programmed and you can't roam the city freely. I'm a bit bummed out, because a game like this could turn out really cool, but i understand that the developers couldn't do more than this beacuse of Sony limiting them. 2 stars because it's really, REALLY well done but i don't understand why make an ad for a non vr platform in vr.
i have a oculus quest 2 and i connected it to my computer to play this and whenever i get to the part where im opening the suit it crashes please fix this

I know this game is old now but Cmon. Every single time I launch the game it crashes almost immedietly. When the suitcase opens opens the game crashes with no explanation. Can someone explain how/if I can fix this.

This was extremely underwhelming. Basically just a tutorial of how to use your web shooter in a small area and then a tiny ineractive scene where you don't really get to move around at all. No demonstration of swinging mechanics at all.

review_title: Great experience. One of the best VR app
one_reviews_text: Thanks!

After playing Far From Home VR by the same developers, I had some good expectations on this, considering that Far From Home VR was a decent experience, though the campaign was short. What I got from this game is a 5 minute ad. The only thing you really do is target practice and then you swing literally just once. This includes the fact you cant control where you swing it just swings for you. This is just an ad for Homecoming and it's dissappointing. The graphics were amazing, they just never added gameplay

For some reason they keep making games like this, there short and boring. I expected some real gameplay but no, Its just a demo, they dont even have plans to make a full game so they impliment good features for a game that is non-exsistant

So... you got you an Oculus. You download a freebee called Spiderman something or other. You downloaded it for one reason. We all downloaded it for one reason. 

To swing from building to building! It's VR! The thill of flying over the streets of the big city!

Nope. One swing. That's it. One. You swing right into the credits. 

Use this engine. Use the Spiderman theme. Make something on the scale of GTAV and you will rule VR gaming. 

(It's very well done and shows what could be done. But it's perfectly empty as it is. It's not even a good commercial for the movie.)

Spiderman home coming

No frikkin way!! The area where the demo is set is in Queens, New York in an area called Sunnyside. From my best estimation, the building street is around the mid 40's and on Queen's Blvd.  The train line is the number 7. I was born in Woodside, on 51st Street and lived 3 blocks off Queens Blvd. I could more or less work out where my old apartment building is! They actually capture my old neighbourhood accurately and I'd have no trouble finding my way around, it looks that familiar. Previous Spiderman games were set in the city, so I'm hoping I'll get the chance to see what my old neighbourhood looks like in a computer. For that reason alone, I give this 5 stars! Can't wait to play this.

For real, it feels like a demo, it teaches you the controls, you really start to have fun, then it just ends, you only barely get two swings in, I want to travel all around new york city this way. the lack of content is the only reason this doesn't get 5 stars, I'd pay full price for a longer experience.
As a beginner this is a short but really wonderfull and nice experience of how to interact...really worth the download :)
It ended when it was getting good

review_title: I know err-one is saying it's short, but
one_reviews_text:
WOW it's short! I didn't know things could be that short. That was really, really short. 8 minutes of game time (2 minutes actually doing anything) for a few gigabytes...
At least I got to finally be Spider-man for 2 seconds, I'm fat in real life so it was a dream come true lmao
This is the best first person super hero game ever! We cannot wait for the full version to come out!

review_title: Looks great but waste of time demo
one_reviews_text:
Seems like it will be a wicked game. I find it hard not to mark it down though because even for a demo this was very short. Even if you stayed in the same area but could mess around for longer it would be better and wouldn't disuade people from wanting the full game to experience more. EDIT: just looking and don't think this is going to be a game.....well, total waste of time then and disappointing.

Perhaps reduce some of the features in game like only having a couple of the web abilities. No joke, the experience lasts around 5 mins.

review_title: Needs more content. Broken at the end.
one_reviews_text: Could be a really good game if it had more content. I get it's an advert, but people would pay for this if it was set up as a proper game. The demo wasn't bad, but the ending is broken. I couldn't do anything despite it working up until that point.

first time after i try "oculus first contact" i just loved it. but, i think the development must keep working to improve it. i think the game will be more interesting if the player can do many more thing as a spiderman. not only flying to the helicopter and than mission complete). overall everything is very good, the animation look like real, the sound is 3d. the web, granade everything working excellent for me. it just need some improvement to make it more have long in game or in a adventure as a spiderman

review_title: Too short ... but fairly well done
one_reviews_text:
The mechanics are all there to create a good game, but this is just a marketing tool, or they're testing the waters to see how many people play it. 
Anyway, if you're a spiderman fan you'll be happy and disapointed.
It's nice to be able to sling web, but it's disapointing not to have an actual game attached to it.

Graphics are ok as far as the rooftop detail goes, but beyond that it's pretty meh.
The experience was amazing. Except it is like 2 minutes long.  If you are expecting a very long and fun Spider-Man game you came to the wrong place.
Even a demo it looks pretty short.

Guys, this is a free demo. And well, it left me like: 'OMG, make this thing happen. I definetely want a full game, high budget triple A-title of this. Just should up and take my freaking money!!'

So I am going to rate this one 5 stars, of course. Yeah, it's a demo. Yeah, it's quiet short. But you are spiderman, standing on roofs and cranes, shooting your webs, swinging from skyscraper to skyscraper over the streets of NYC. Whoah, it's so immersive. Such a great view. So controls with OCULUS Touch are already working so smoothly. Give me more. I just beg for more! :-)
this is way to short, the webslinging is restricted and feels akward
Excellent but far too short! Pleeeeaasseee make a longer game out of this, I'd put down good money for a full game like this
extra
Maybe it's not a waste of time, because it's so short, you won't miss it.

I was gonna skip this because I thought it'd be some rushed tie-in going from the ratings and how some of these movie tie-in experiences have been but this is geuinely awesome. It is short yes, but it's also free and it nails being Spiderman so much so that I would buy a full game of this in a heartbeat. Do check this out, it's a lot of fun and be wary if you have a fear of heights ;)
way to short

Its extremely short, but its free. If I paid money I would be disapointed with the length. I REALLY hope this gets turned into a full fledged game with fun locomotion, it has the potential to be fantastic. I would recomend everyone give it a try.

This may be free, but thats no exuse for really really really poor quality of assets and mechanics the entire thing is rail roaded and the mecanics are just point a shoot with no movement. The level of quality for both assets and mechanics is what you would expect from a school project. it truely is disapointing.
just its too short

review_title: Proof of concept, not a game
one_reviews_text: There's a tutorial on how to use the web slingers, one actual web sling, and then a single enemy you can shoot at for 10 seconds....and then nothing. This has great potential, but there's just no game here.

It's free, so there's that. But it is an experience largely on rails. The few things you get to do, like shoot jars, and use several different types of webs is extremely short. Also the hands are small, disorientingly so, and on my rig jitter like my Grandpa's used to. I set the touch controller on a table to make sure it wasn't just too much coffee, and they still shake. It gets two stars and not one because I am an unabashed Spiderman fan. But I felt disappointed at the end of the experience.

review_title: Great to show frist timers VR
one_reviews_text: Great to show frist timers VR, everyone has a great laugh at the end :D

review_title: It's a free demo for a reason
one_reviews_text: So I didn't expect much and the demo delivered on my very low expecations.  There's very little to do.  The tutorial is longer than the game.  It could be forgiven if the tutorial was actually fun, but it's kind of dull.  Then the action takes place, it takes about 2 minutes.  It's kind of held back by the fact that you really can't move.  It has some nice action sequences, but they are brief.  Then it all ends.  This is an play once and uninstall, unless you have a kid that really loves Spiderman.
freerome

Virtually no content for such a large game storage-wise, and it just isn't very high quality. If this was made into a full-fledged, fully-locomotive game that gave you options for things like removing the black border while swinging for those of us who don't get motion-sick, then I would absolutely buy it. Currently, not even worth the time I spent playing it.

Short teser, but clearly highlights the potential such a game has. In less than 10 minutes of gameplay I already feel like Im ready to sling throughout newyork. Shame its so short, please make something out of it.
Really not worth the time to download for less than two minutes of gameplay, which consists of pointing at things and clicking on them.
Like dude it's over before anything cool happends, its way too short. Just pass it.

review_title: Dont expect to web sling through NY
one_reviews_text: Its very shot and you only shoot web balls at things. The only two moments you web sling to another location are scripted.

review_title: Another one asking for a minigame
one_reviews_text: Just like Bullet Train this game just ends prematurely on its own, instead of giving me the choice to quit when I'm absolutely bored. Your only options is to start from beginning. I know it's free, but at least give me some kind of minigame that takes longer than 2 minutes. Even some kind of shooting gallery would do. In its current state, simply... WHATEVER!
It felt like a demo to me so I'm really hoping a full game comes out about this because that was awesome!
like what is this just a short demo and training gig and once the weapon traing is over it shuts down. nothing here. just a short weapon traing gig and the end. really nonsence

This is just a sneek-peek...
But the controls & immersion feel just right!
If it grows into a full game, it will be a must buy...
Essentially the callibration for a tutorial. Not even enough to qualify for a demo imo. Just a 4GB trailer.
this is a very basic game. pretty much a tutorial, then its over. you cant ask for too much from a free game though

review_title: Sucks. You get 2 "Web Swings" then done.
one_reviews_text:
The "tutorial" takes forever. Shows you like 8 weapons. Cool. Let's do web swining!

NO. You get two. Then demo ends. Lame.
Wooow im blown away, get to be a spiderman for few minutes. More games like this please
great demo, wish it was longer, please make this a full game
Fun but short experience. Mostly a target practice session. Missed opportunity to be able to swing around a city in 3D which would have been epic.

review_title: So much potential, but FAR too short!
one_reviews_text: This game feels like it could be like Batman Arkham VR but better in some regards. But it's WAY too short for what it could be. It feels like an incomplete tutorial level and you could be done in 2 minutes. Shame with the physics and everything, feels like a giant missed oppourtunity.

review_title: meh. ok tutorial, then its over
one_reviews_text: right when i was excited to see what this game can do, it ended. lame. but meh it was free.
Excellent demo - more game please!
People are being way to uptight on this one, yes its very short and once the fun starts its over, but its free! no reason not to play to experience spidey for a sec.

review_title: Now I just really want Spiderman Vr
one_reviews_text: This has great potential, but it's really short. I want to swing around the city as spiderman now.

I knew it wasn't going to be anything special going in with but it's just awful. Hand models look like they're made out of clay, controls 2/10, animations 1/10, it lasted like 4 minutes. The vulcher doesn't do anything, he comes by blows up a crane, you press a button and it magically fixes itself, the end.

Looks like a 5 minute demo of a game that could be amazing. It is way to short but really fun and interesting must try. You will be dissapointed on the shortness of the app. So Marvel,Intel,Dell, and Sony Pictures you should complete this project, making it a full game.

I know the tendency of today is to just vomit data all over the user's disk (if it even is still an actual disk), but this is a 15-minute demo scene that takes as much data as a hour-long movie!

Very misleading, I thought at this size it would be a playable game. Lo and behold, it barely covers what I'd expect to be found in a tutorial level....

After donning the costume you are given a moment to admire yourself in a mirror. I took this opportunity to place my hands on my hips and strike a heroic pose. This is when I realized that since my elbows don't have tracking, the sensors have no idea they exist, which leaves my avatar with this arms hanging at his sides and his wrists contorted impossibly looking every bit like the infamous Spiber-Man! Go Spiber-Man!!!!!

Worth a download, but honestly only worth playing through once or twice. It's a real short, and ends just as you the real fun begins. I really wish they allowed you to swing more. I think I would love to see an Iron Man or Spider-Man VR game.
...but too short... nice experience for free...
It's a bit too short but fun to play. Really hope to see a real game come out.
Awesome but its way to short. We need spiderman vr. Where its open world and you can be spiderman
Even for free, this was a massive disapointment.

review_title: First step into the right direction
one_reviews_text:
I can only imagine how amazing a whole Spider-Man VR game must be based on this free(!) trailer demo.
But I don't understand people who expect a 90 minutes experience with AAA content and graphics when they download and play this little gem.
Anyway, thank you for allowing me to be Spider-Man for a short time. My inner child is finally satisfied.
Short but nice free demo
Of course it's not a real game, it's just a quick, 5-10 minutes demo and ad for spiderman. I would still recommand it if you have little time and someone wants to test VR.

first of i would like to say why on earth anyone can give this a bad review, its like you dont realize the fact your in a virtual reality and not only that your shooting virtual webs from your wrists and your SPIDERMAN!!!
its very polished it has a little humour and its free yah it may only be few mins long but for thoses few minutes you get a sense of what being spiderman would be like. when you play it get the most out of it realise all the small details and hard work that has been put into it for you!!! dont expect the world VR is a few years old just enjoy it :) and happy gaming :D

review_title: the tutorial for an unfinished game
one_reviews_text: this could have been a nice tutorial for a spiderman game that simply isn't there. I wonder why they left the game like this, with no contents but just with this cool tutorial. meh.
I choose to look at this as a movie advertisement.  A fun one at that.  This could be a full game if sombody would put the effort in.

review_title: Wish it was a full game
one_reviews_text: Ive played a lot of amazing VR games but this was my favorite, but i wish it was a full game so 4 stars for a taste and i hope they make it a full game.

Quite Fun ... look like Marvel try to follow DC (With Batman Arkham VR) at least it is free ... but last for 5 minutes to complete ... Another experience with great potential ... But They must do Games Not experience !!!

This could be the tutorial for what would be a great game. Just as you start to use your web sling for locomotion it is over. If they turned this into a full game with this much polish I would buy it instantly!!!

Definately worth trying as its free. Very short but teases with a taster of more to come. Graphics are very good as you would expect from the unreal engine. A lot of hard work has gone into the making of this. A bit like Robo Recall being on top of a building. Loved the sky and looking over building as I leaned over. Sound could have been better taking you more into the experience as not much going on. The swinging experience (not in this) but the future game could cause motion sickness so I hope they can find a solution to this or offer comfort options. The game is a good taster for the scope of just what is possible with VR (heights, size and scale of city, swinging, feeling immersed and being a superhero) These adverts are great because they are free but give you a taster in my opinion. Keep em coming :-)

review_title: A Missed opportunity to show off VR
one_reviews_text: This app soley was to promote the Spiderman movie, and while it was cool and fun, it was less then 7min long. I know its free but, the studio could have thrown less then 1% of their ad budget and made a great 30min experience. That saying "You get what you paid for" in this case I really feel they missed an opportunity to not only promote the movie but show off VR!!

I was excited to try this out. I surely wasn't expecting a full game or even close to it, but it really isn't that good at all. You don't really have any control over yourself in the game aside from aiming and it was over so quickly. My son is a big fan of Spidey and we were both left disappointed.

The opportunity to experience a lifelong dream... To be Spiderman... There are so many things that could've been done better, and I'm not talking about what's already there, that is great enough because you get to experience being Spiderman. Just, give me a reason to be there for a couple hours, a couple of days... Waves, a survival mode, 1-2 boss fights, leaderboards. 

Instead, I was given a 5mins demo of what could've been a lot nicer.

So far, pretty much everything that Sony Pictures Virtual Reality has put out as been put down, I understand why you guys went with the free route this time around but I must say, for such a powerful brand, that didn't feel like much of an effort. WB got some serious advance when it comes to VR, you guys need to play catch up and these only increase the gap. (Need I remind you that Nvidia made you guys front news for driver updates...A shame is what it is)

As a free preview to something you might want to buy, I have to say it is pretty lame.  I was excited to swing about, but the mechanic for swinging, whilst only used twice, is not what I would have wanted.  This does not in any way blow me away and leave me gasping to buy the full game.  Sorry.

For a free game, there is no reason not to rate this 5 stars. This could easily be one of the top titles on Oculus if it were a full game. Great job to the dev team that put this together and gave it to us for free. I hope to one day see a full version of this realized. This is hands down the best demo on Rift.

GREAT DEMO. 5 STARS
disappointing. I know it's just a free promo but still, it could have been so much better. Felt very generic
very short Demo but i like it. Could be a good game once.

Aside from the fact that this is a short playable trailer, its not that bad. I would have enjoyed a bit more to do (like swinging around, climbing walls and such). 

I'll keep my eye out for a full version if it ever gets turned into a real game.
Just some quick interactions and that's it?
Not a great game, but the first VR spiderman experience and I'll take it. It'll be interesting to see how this series evolves.

... if you go into it knowing what to expect: basically, a short but playable ad for a movie with unrealistic web effects but pretty good physics and a nicely rendered city scene. Basically, it was short but fun.

Really nicely put together, enjoyed the physics and how all the objects reacted to the web slinger, shame it ended just as you started swinging through the city, would have been great if that sequence lasted a bit longer.

review_title: SO much potential... so little hope
one_reviews_text: GUYS HOW AWESOME WOULD A VR SPIDERMAN BE WHERE YOU COULD SWOOP THROUGH THE CITY BEING A HERO? Well, this demo doesn't show *anything* that hints that kind of functionality is in the works. Major disappointment.

Pros: Graphics are decent enough. 
Cons: You are never really given full reign of the weapons. 
Very very short
Finishes just as getting good. 

A demo with just some decent web swinging through the streets would have been awesome. This isn't.

review_title: Good Short ride make it into a full game
one_reviews_text: A nice short concept demo, It would be great as a full blown Spiderman Game, the web swing mechanic works perfectly in a VR world. The high buildings and city look nice  and are nicely detailed and the web shooters work great with the Touch Controllers!

review_title: Waste of a download. Really bad.
one_reviews_text: Don't bother.
Lasts well under 10 Minutes, had much more potential.
A little proof of concept as to what a Spiderman VR game could be.

Exceptionally terrible, though it's free it just isn't done very well, very poorly implemented mechanics, super short, huge file size for something so insubstantial. Don't waste your time. Sony sure wasted their money.
Ever since the begining of VR I wanted to be in a marvel characters shoes. This disappoints with how short it is. They could have at least made a free city mode where you can just swing around.
Agree with everyone in the comments - expand this game, and you'll tether-web my wallet right into your pocket! Great promotional piece. Can't wait to see the film.

I honestly don't understand why they made this. It's like the opening cinematic to a cellphone game from 5 years ago. I don't mean that's how it starts, I mean that's the whole thing. It's free, but it's not worth the time you'd put into playing it.  Two stars because it's technically functional. Skip it.
They should really make this a full game because it was really fun.. even though it was like 2 mins long.  I really thought I was going to fall off that crane and nearly fell to the floor, lol.
way too short
This game could be REALLY pleasant if it didn't just stop the second it get exciting ! The developers of this experience must be sadistic ! This is SOOO FRUSTRATING !
Althrough its free, there is a lot of potential for a full VR Spider-Man game.
This is a very short demo that ends just as it starts to feel exciting. Looks more than okay and would be interesting to see what a full game would be like.
Please remember guys, this is a freebie to promote the film. Imagine how much potential a full-on Spiderman game could have. Look past the short play time and poor hand models.
This could have been amazing on google cardboard 4 years ago.

review_title: Xcellent Quality but ended b4 i began ;)
one_reviews_text: Quality and scope of VR games by Marvel is very appealing
Would be great if this were an actual game where the gameplay was longer than the tutorial ;D
Great little teaser, pretty good quality. Well done
It is short and free. The quality of the game is fantastic.
Was really looking forward to this!!  Sadly it fails in every single way.

Spider-man, spider-man, A VR tie-in? I'm feeling sad. 
At least it isn't very long, just play Windlands, you won't go wrong. 
Look out! Here comes the boring ad..
Very long tutorial for about 10 seconds of game play. Lots of lost potential.
i expected more
pretty good idea - will be interesting to see if they turn it into a proper game.

1. It's Free
2. It uses rift perfectly.
3. It's spiderman and YOU CAN SWING THROUGH AIR
Even for free it's a bit boring.  Just training how to use different shots that you never use in the game.  Much better free experiences out there.
If you like Spidey check it out, but boil the jug before you start it, and you can have a fresh coffee by the time it's finished.
Game has sooooo much potential and could have been super fun. However, all you get is the starter of a tutorial. Its 5 mins long.
In full version, please disable tunnel vision when moving and make the game mechanics more similar to Windlands.

I was enjoying the game when it suddenly finished. I want some more.
it's a kind of tutorial and when it's about to begin... :'(
I get that it's free but minus the tutorials the actual game is about 10 seconds long. Not worth the 2 GB download
2-3 web jumps are really nice.I felt like spidermen.Graphics is nice and realistic. But most of time is shooting to bottles.
But it's a free, amusing shooting gallery experience for a few minutes. Why not give it a go if you like Spiderman?
Just when the game gets good it ends, what a good way to piss people off.  Just a marketing scam for the new movie.

review_title: Too short even for a Promo
one_reviews_text: Couldve at least added a few more swings...
Felt like a beta demo
Felt like Spider-Man for a handful of minutes! Got me pumped for the movie!
go watch the new movie, dont bother about this. this not where VR comercials should be going.
just an advertisment for some movie
This has potential and could of been a great demo of VR but it just too short.
Only 10 minutes, but it could be a nice new FULL fun game next year...
a quick shooting gallery and two brief web-swingings.  not terrible.
only 5 minutes of "game"?!  its just a half tutorial :/
i love the end but it's to short, I wait for a real game.
Im my favorite superhero but for 5 minutes.
give it a go, its free, and shows potential
Super short, super boring.
It's free.
good
I update my Windows 7 but the game doesn't not work
Steam version works perfect in Win 8.1. There's no sense this is Win10 only. Same case with Raw Data and other experiences.
